chapter_title: 3.3 Russia’s Use of Cluster Munitions
section_title: In all, 14 people were injured in the first strike.

events.label: Second Strike Occurs
events.description: A second strike hit a group of individuals, resulting in one death and multiple injuries.

testimonies.excerpt: I heard a jet. The bomb fell and exploded. I was wounded in the leg, chest, back, fingers.

chapter_title: 3.3 Russia’s Use of Cluster Munitions

testimonies.excerpt: I showed Human Rights Watch a canister with the inscription RBK-500/AO-2.5 RTM.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTM in cyrillic. Kereselidze had seen two more canisters nearby, but they had been

testimonies.excerpt: I found four unexploded AO-2.5 RTM submunitions in my garden.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50
2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50
section_title: Variani and the fields just outside it.293

events.label: First Cluster Munition Attack in Variani
events.description: Georgian ground troops had just entered Tskhinvali when the first cluster munition attack occurred in Variani.

events.label: Second Cluster Munition Attack
events.description: At the time of the second attack, Georgian troops had retreated from Tskhinvali and reportedly left Gori city.

testimonies.excerpt: [Contamination] has interfered with my harvest. I couldn’t collect because I couldn’t get into my fields because they were occupied [by troops].
Deminers cleared 27 submunitions from my cherry orchard.
Deminers had cleared four submunitions from my garden.
Deminers had cleared two submunitions from my home.
Two submunitions had been removed from my home.
I reported two explosions and six duds in my yard.
I reported four explosions and three duds in my and my neighbor’s yard.
There were troops in town at other times, but not at the time of this incident.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: Russian forces used cluster munitions in attacks on Variani, violating humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50

events.label: Cluster Munition Strike in Ruisi
events.description: Russian forces struck the village of Ruisi using Uragan rockets carrying 9N210 submunitions, resulting in civilian casualties.

events.label: Cluster Munition Strike in Dzlevijvari
events.description: The village of Dzlevijvari was struck by cluster munitions, leading to significant physical evidence of the attack.

testimonies.excerpt: When we found him he had numerous wounds. His head was broken. His brains were out. His legs and hand were sliced off.
When the bombing started I decided to return to Ruisi to seek cover in a house about 300 meters from the place where Goginashvili died.
I found a canister for 9N210 about 100 meters from the place where Goginashvili died.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: The use of Uragan rockets carrying 9N210 submunitions in populated areas constitutes a violation of humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50

events.label: Cluster Munition Strike in Ruisi
events.description: A cluster munition strike hit the village of Ruisi, resulting in casualties and injuries among civilians.

testimonies.excerpt: I saw the rocket was shot and fell not far away from where I was. Something hit me in the stomach.
Planes were flying around and dropping bombs... We could feel the blast waves from the explosions.
The injured women and neighbors showed Human Rights Watch an Uragan rocket and 9N210 fragments.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: The use of cluster munitions in civilian areas, resulting in civilian casualties and injuries.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50

events.label: Attack in Ruisi Village
events.description: A shelling incident occurred in the village of Ruisi, resulting in the death of Amiran Vardzelashvili.

testimonies.excerpt: Most villagers said that Georgian troops had moved through the village the previous day, but had left before the attack.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50
section_title: Gori city—Iskander SS-26 missile with submunitions

events.label: Cluster Munitions Attack in Gori
events.description: A cluster munitions attack occurred in Gori city, killing six civilians and injuring many others who were gathered for food distribution.

testimonies.excerpt: There was a big explosion above us and the next moment there were many smaller explosions everywhere.
In a couple of seconds from everywhere I heard what sounded like massive gunfire. We fell on the ground and some people never got up.
My right leg was shredded as a result of the attack.

violations.description: Use of cluster munitions in populated areas, resulting in civilian casualties.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50

events.label: Georgian Troops Leave Gori
events.description: All Georgian troops had left the city of Gori by the evening, according to witnesses.

events.label: Cluster Munitions Strike on Gori
events.description: A cluster munitions strike hit Gori’s main square, resulting in casualties including cameraman Stan Storimans.

events.label: Dutch Investigative Commission Dispatched
events.description: The Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs sent a commission to Gori to investigate the death of cameraman Stan Storimans.

testimonies.excerpt: All witnesses said that there were no military forces on the square when it was attacked.

violations.label: Use of Cluster Munitions
violations.description: Russian forces used cluster munitions in a strike on Gori’s main square, violating humanitarian law.

chapter_title: 2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50
2.5 RTMs and the separation rings of two more. We heard reports of an additional 50

events.label: Russian Ministry of Defense Denies Use of Iskander
events.description: The Russian Ministry of Defense stated that Russian forces did not use the Iskander missile system in South Ossetia.

violations.description: Use of cluster munitions by Russian forces in Georgia.

chapter_title: 3.4 Tank Attacks on Civilian Homes

events.label: Russian Tanks Fire on Tamarasheni
events.description: Russian tanks fired on homes in Tamarasheni, indicating indiscriminate attacks on civilian structures.

events.label: Russian Soldiers Enter Tamarasheni
events.description: Russian soldiers entered a house in Tamarasheni where civilians were hiding, checking for armed men.

testimonies.excerpt: Three tanks would stand one after another, point their barrels in different directions and start shooting at houses.
I heard a big explosion and a big hole appeared in my house. I think it was tank fire.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces conducted attacks on civilian homes without distinguishing between military and civilian targets.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Aerial Attack on Civilian Convoy
events.description: Russian military aircraft attacked civilian convoys fleeing the conflict zone near Eredvi, resulting in casualties among non-combatants.

testimonies.excerpt: There was an explosion. Perhaps four or five cars were hit... I saw that people were injured and killed. There was blood.
It was an aerial attack. There were five [Russian] planes... There were no military troops around. All the vehicles were civilian.

violations.description: Intentional firing on civilian vehicles that posed no apparent military threat.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

events.label: Explosions Near Eredvi
events.description: Tengiz Magaldadze witnessed three explosions while driving with 20 others, concluding they were likely caused by Russian forces.

events.label: Attack on Civilians in Pkhvenisi
events.description: Nunu Chlaidze and others fled Pkhvenisi after Russian forces attacked military targets, leading to collateral damage to civilian homes.

testimonies.excerpt: I saw three explosions about 20 to 25 meters in front of the vehicle.
Our car came under fire at a Russian military roadblock.

violations.label: Indiscriminate Attacks on Civilians
violations.description: The attacks on civilian convoys near Eredvi violated international humanitarian law, potentially constituting a war crime.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

testimonies.excerpt: When we entered Variani I told Amiran to be careful because there were tanks in front. Then they started shooting at us. There was massive gunfire.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

testimonies.excerpt: I was hiding behind the seat when I was wounded and ran into the tank.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: They thought that I was dead. Then I ran away.328

testimonies.excerpt: I felt unsafe at the hospital and ran away. I had no information about my husband’s fate.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Attack on taxi in Tedotsminda, August 12

events.label: Attack on Taxi by Russian Forces
events.description: Two women were killed when Russian forces fired on their taxi while traveling from Gori to Shindisi.

testimonies.excerpt: Russians fired without any kind of warning. The car was almost completely destroyed.
We saw an Opel taxi pass by... The tank apparently fired on the car, and the car went off the road, exploded and caught fire.
Russian troops denied an ambulance access to the area to collect the two women’s remains.

violations.label: Attack on Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces fired on a civilian taxi, resulting in the deaths of two women.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone
section_title: Attack on civilian car in Akhaldaba, August 12

events.label: Russian Aircraft Attack Television Tower
events.description: Russian aircraft began attacking the television tower near Akhaldaba, targeting the Karaleti and Shindisi areas.

events.label: Tank Fire on Civilians
events.description: As Khekhelashvili and Papuashvili were being driven back to the village, they encountered tanks that opened fire on their vehicle.

testimonies.excerpt: I felt a bullet skim the top of my head. Someone shouted, 'Get down!' and we all bent over.

violations.description: Civilians were fired upon by soldiers on tanks while trying to escape.

chapter_title: 3.5 Attacks by Russian Forces on Civilians Fleeing the Conflict Zone

testimonies.excerpt: When they brought the body back we saw that there was a bullet wound to his forehead that had not been there when we left him—apparently a control shot.

violations.label: Control Shot on Deceased
violations.description: A bullet wound was found on the forehead of a deceased individual, indicating a potential execution after death.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians

events.label: Russian Forces Assault Civilians
events.description: Russian soldiers entered the home of Ilia Chulukidze, beat him, and searched for weapons.

testimonies.excerpt: They broke the door and one put a weapon in my face; others ran upstairs looking for something. They started beating me.

violations.label: Pillaging and Violence Against Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces, together with Ossetian militias, engaged in pillaging and violence against civilians, violating international law.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians

testimonies.excerpt: Men in camouflage—presumably Ossetian militia fighters—arrived on Russian tanks in my village.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians
section_title: Karaleti (in Gori district), and torched his house:

events.label: Looting and Arson by Ossetians and Russian Forces
events.description: Armed Ossetians and Russian forces looted and set fire to the homes of Marine and Teimuraz Tetunashvili.

testimonies.excerpt: They jumped off and started shooting at the house. They said, 'Give us your cow and money.'
I was just begging them, 'Don’t kill me, take whatever you want, but don’t kill me!'

violations.description: Looting and burning of civilian homes.

chapter_title: 3.6 Pillaging, Destruction, Violence, and Threats against Civilians

events.label: Looting in Koshka
events.description: Looters, both Russian and Ossetian, entered Koshka after the village had been shelled, stealing from houses and setting them on fire.

events.label: Continued Looting in Koshka
events.description: Looters continued to ransack houses in Koshka, moving in groups and committing acts of arson.

testimonies.excerpt: I witnessed looters entering the village in groups of 15, stealing everything and setting fire to houses.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

events.label: Georgian Forces Officially Retreat
events.description: Georgian forces officially retreated, marking the beginning of Russian control over South Ossetia.

events.label: Russian Forces Gain Control of Gori District
events.description: Russian forces moved through Gori district, gaining control of the area.

events.label: Russian Troops Withdraw from Gori
events.description: Russian troops pulled back further north toward South Ossetia, ending their control over Gori city.

events.label: Russian Forces Withdraw to South Ossetia Border
events.description: Russian forces withdrew to the South Ossetia administrative border, ending their occupation of adjacent areas.

violations.label: Failure to Protect Civilians
violations.description: Russian forces violated their obligation as an occupying power by failing to ensure public order and safety for civilians.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power
3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

testimonies.excerpt: A senior member of the Russian military in the region said that the military was given no mandate for protection of civilians.

violations.label: Grave Breaches of Geneva Conventions
violations.description: Russian forces were involved in grave breaches of the Geneva Conventions, including execution and torture of prisoners of war.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

events.label: Russian Minister Promises to Stop Looting
events.description: Following reports of looting in ethnic Georgian villages, Russian Minister Rashid Nurgaliev stated that looting would be decisively stopped.

events.label: Checkpoints Established by Russian Forces
events.description: Russian forces established checkpoints on a key road, preventing access to five ethnic Georgian villages.

testimonies.excerpt: We’re now trying to stop the looters. They steal and set fire to things … I see no end to this.

chapter_title: 3.7 Russia’s Responsibility as Occupying Power

testimonies.excerpt: Human Rights Watch researchers witnessed numerous confrontations between Russian servicemen and Ossetian militias.
